channel.title: Landscape editor help
channel.description: I'm not entirely sure if this is where this belongs or not, but I'll ask it here. I've been having a problem with the landscape editor for the game. I load up an area, it loads it, but it usually appears as a giant pinkish-purple block, with the actual landscape to be edited on one of the sides. I'd be all fine and dandy here, but the problem would be *bum bum bum...!!!!* I can only edit what's pink. I tried to select (right click, in this case) an area with at least a texture on it, but nothing appears in the text box to edit, and no "selected green square" appears where I click. Is this a known problem, or am I loading the wrong area models?

item.title: Landscape editor help
item.dc:creator: @Asylum Asylum
item.description:
@Asylum wrote:

[quote=“The_AFKer, post:14, topic:361029”][quote author=deadheart link=topic=457317.msg3358451#msg3358451 date=1286127513]
You don’t need Ant, his variables aren’t set up properly. He’s probably missing the class variable in both local and system variables.
[/quote]

What in the fuck are you on about? I think you are mistaken with environmental variables the system uses to find paths for running Ant or related programs.[/quote]

Lets just save our time and establish that he doesn’t know what ANT or environmental variables are.

Read full topic

item.title: Landscape editor help
item.dc:creator: @The_AFKer The_AFKer
item.description:
@The_AFKer wrote:

deadheart:

You don’t need Ant, his variables aren’t set up properly. He’s probably missing the class variable in both local and system variables.

What in the fuck are you on about? I think you are mistaken with environmental variables the system uses to find paths for running Ant or related programs.

Read full topic

Instructions are in the readme, all you do is load the landscape.rscd and edit where you want, if you have trouble, feel free to send me a message.[/quote]

item.description:
@deadheart wrote:

Can you give me a link to that one? I’ve searched and found it, but it’s link was dead. I’m using some .exe one, not a java one so that’s probably why. It won’t load the .rscd file.

item.title: Landscape editor help
item.dc:creator: @hornyhamster hornyhamster
item.description:
@hornyhamster wrote:

You should be using the RSC community Landscape Editor.

It should look like this:

http://img23.imageshack.us/img23/9260/87240468.png

Please post an image of the messed up editor.

The thing you should be editing is Landscape.rscd

Read full topic
